website_summaries.verdict: A great, affordable set of masonry bits that still offers good quality.
pros: This set includes five tungsten carbide tipped bits in sizes from 1/4" to 1/2"
Can be used with tile, concrete, brick, plastic, and wood
Drills easily and is ideal for home/occasional use
cons: Those who use masonry drill bits on a regular basis will need a higher quality set

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for drilling into pots!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted drill bits so I could make drainage holes in some of my pots. The bits worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: ShadowRaven

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Seems pretty durable.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the job I bought it for: drilling drainage holes in glazed ceramic pots. I used my cordless drill and it cut right through the glaze without seeming to lose sharpness after 10 or twelve holes. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: I. Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Takes care of business
customer_reviews.text: Needed a good bit to hang a fireplace mantle after several concrete bits just lost the edge quickly going in to brick. The bit from this set drilled the hole I needed very quickly and smoothly without losing any of its integrity. I am back on its listing as I am considering another set to have on hand. Very impressive bits.
customer_reviews.author: L. L.

customer_reviews.title: Like them, they got the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to drill a hole in a fondue pot so I could use it as a planter, and this got the job done. I thought they were kind of bad quality at first because it took quite a while to drill through, but then I realized I was drilling through "stone-ware" hardened pottery. I later used them on terracotta and they drilled through like butter. Nice little hard plastic case too.
customer_reviews.author: H. Brook

customer_reviews.title: Never used a drill bit like this before and it was a great experience to ...
customer_reviews.text: Never used a drill bit like this before and it was a great experience to have a try. It is in a glass drill bit shape but can also perform as a robust masonry drill bit. I first used one bit to do a test drilling on a waste tile. It drilled through very well. Then I used it to do some holes in bathroom. It ran fast and easily penetrated the ceramic tile and concrete without using any water. After several holes drilling it still worked as a new bit. Very tough bit head, worked very well as advertised..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Father of All  flower pot drill bits.
customer_reviews.text: My wife forced me to drill holes in her flower pots . Around 9 or so. I had some cheap bits that I used. They couldn't drill through butter. These came in the mail today and I was able to drill those god forsaken flower pots that she puts pointy cactus in. OMG I love to move those into the garage in the summer time. I usually end up in the emergency room needing a blood transfusion I get stuck so bad bye their spiky little thorns. . Great !!!!!! Product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LAR

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 brand name tile drill bits from Home Depot for use at home and they all failed badly. I was literally scared of working with tile until bought this one. These bits drill into ceramic tile like into tofu :). I feels pretty confident now while working on tile. It was just amazing to see these bits drill into ceramic tile in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a drill bit for years that was a true concrete drill bit. Well, I found it. This was delivered 5 minutes ago, I put it in my drill, went outside, and it went through my concrete like it was butter. Now that's what I'm talking about. Prior to this, my other brand new concrete drill bits from Lowes took me 2 hours to drill 1 hole. These bits did it in a fraction of a second. Am I buying more, hell yeah.
customer_reviews.author: HARRY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for making drainage holes for plants
customer_reviews.text: Worked surprisingly well-the bits aren't terribly sharp though so it does take a bit of drilling time. Go slow and use water as it does get very hot. I also recommend starting with one of the smaller bits and then using a larger bit if you want to enlarge the hole which is what I did. So far I've drilled through a thick ceramic pot, a plastic pot, and this glass jar. Definitely exceeded expectations for the money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: audrey

customer_reviews.title: Exactly was I needed for the right price
customer_reviews.text: I used these drill bits on my mom's bathroom tile to install and hand bar and they worked beautifully! Just make sure you don't apply too much pressure (or speed) on the drill, otherwise you'll end up cracking the tile. I watched a few videos where they warn about this potential problem. You just have to be patience, I guess that's the trick with these things. It took me a good 45 seconds to drill a 1/2" deep hole on the tile, so I didn't think it was not too bad at all. The hole itself ended up being clear and very round; all ready for the next step on the project.
customer_reviews.author: norbac

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long on glass tile.
customer_reviews.text: As a craftsman I thought only a novice would ruing a drill bit when tackling glass tile. The secret is keeping the bit cool, the hole wet, and the pressure light even though a perfect hole may take on a half hour to complete. The first bit failed right away. The second bit was painfully slow and all was well until the bit passed through the tile - when I removed the bit from the hole, the tile cracked. This cycle repeated itself on the remaining 3 holes. Bits are worthless after a single use - so plan on stocking up ahead of your job.
customer_reviews.author: professor1950

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, slowly on crock
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bits to drill a 10 gallon antique glazed stoneware crock. The walls are probably 5/8" thick. I drilled two holes, starting with the smallest bit, then mid size, then largest, while flowing water on the sites continuously. It seemed to take forever, actually probably about twenty minutes per hole. The bits removed material at a snail's pace but eventually got it done when no other bits I tried would even mark the surface of the glassy glaze. Would probably work better on other surfaces. I'd buy again for the purpose I used them for.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for drilling drainage holes
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for drilling holes in pots!! I wasn’t sure because the reviews are here and there, but as soon as these bad boys showed up, I started drilling holes and they work amazingly. The bits don’t walk, either. I used the middle sized bit easily on thick and thin pots with no problems. The world is my oyster now - anything can be a pot!
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Bad steel - Broke all the bits but one 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these is pretty bad. I was drilling into ceramic floor tile and the cutting blade on top would crumble in just a few seconds. I did not let them overheat. Instead, I drilled for about 5 seconds and then swapped bits and even with this easy load the bits were toast after a few cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bryant

customer_reviews.title: It drills ceramic pots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to up my planter game and drill holes for drainage. I've only drilled one hole, but with putting the pot upside down under a non direct stream of water from the faucet, as well as stopping and starting periodically to avoid breaking the bit from overheating, I was able to drill a hole in a 2" ceramic planter bottom. It may have taken a while, but it worked and everything is still in one, unchipped, solid piece, minus the gaper in the planter.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Xterra

customer_reviews.title: Durable multi-material drill bits
customer_reviews.text: These are solid and functional drill bits that work well for tile, brick, and other ceramics. They are designed for two or more materials simultaneously so you don't have to switch bits when going through brick or tile backed by wood or some other material. The tradeoff is that the bit is a little slower to drill through dense material such as ceramic than a normal tile bit. But it works great and gives an nice clean drill hole.
customer_reviews.author: LS1866

customer_reviews.title: Whew, saved my porcelain tiles!
customer_reviews.text: Used these drill bits for mounting a microwave to the wall that had newly installed porcelain tiles. The contractor brought his own drill bits and swiftly switched to mines (these). He said it felt like it would have taken him 2 hours with his set but with mines “it went straight through”. It didn’t wear out either. Saved me tons of time and headache trying to preserve my tiles and get a project completed smoothly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DC Lady

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great on Carrara Marble Backsplash
customer_reviews.text: I needed to drill about 10 holes in our Carrara marble backsplash to mount shelves. Ended up only using a single bit - which ground out the holes pretty easily - 20 seconds per hole. The bit itself is still sharp - seems to not have dulled at all. The bit tips have some sort of plastic coating that wears off as soon as you use it. Overall, this was a bit cheaper (pun intended) then the set I bought at home depot last year and seem better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cire Gastav

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed, price was great
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding for drilling into brick for anchors, I was using my 18 volt drill and needed a 12mm Hole. I started with a pilot hole using the 6mm bit, moved up to the 10mm, then went to 12mm. I found it difficult to drill into the brick if I started with the 12mm but using the pilot hole method it worked great
customer_reviews.author: Jay Burton

customer_reviews.title: They got the job done. Glad I had two of the same size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put up the shower door and for the toilet flange screws. I already had some really good concrete drill bits, but got these just in case because they were low cost. The "good" bits didn't work at all. These chewed right through the tile. I did break one, but the set had two of the same size. Glad I got them, would get again if I had another tile job to do.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Did the job perfectily
customer_reviews.text: Drills held up quite nicely drilling through solid glass tiles mounted to a cement backboard. Took a bit to time and had to constantly be wetting the surface being drilled to keep the bit from overheating and losing its sharpness. They give you two of the same size smaller bits as the smaller size is usually used to get a hole started and then move to the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: 20mm == 1/2"?  Don't believe it.
customer_reviews.text: These are MASONRY bits. That means that the whole will most likely have zero give. Do NOT assume that 20mm will be fine for a 1/2" clearance. 20mm is smaller than 1/2" by a non-trivial amount. I used this to drill a 20mm hole which then could not fit SNAPTOGGLE bolts that required a 1/2" hole. If it asks for 1/2 inch, you need 1/2 inch. Not 20mm.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ross

customer_reviews.title: drills porcelain tile VERY easily
customer_reviews.text: At first i purchased the Bosch Blue Devil bits because my contractor used them on granite successfully. But they barely worked on my porcelain tiles. I struggled to barely drill thru just the surface. These Qwork bits drilled through with so little effort. about 15 seconds and i had a perfectly clean hole. Not sure how long each bit will last, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Marina N

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Pot did not crack
customer_reviews.text: Used these to drill drainage holes into gardening pots. Works great. Pot did not crack. I used masking tape on the pot so the bit would not slide around, and then I used a spray bottle filled with ice water to spray the area where the bit touch the pot as I was drilling. I just kept spraying as I was drilling and the pots did not crack.
customer_reviews.author: J Burns

customer_reviews.title: Pull bottom down to open package!
customer_reviews.text: I hope they let me modify this in a few months when I actually have time to use these bits. I might rate them 5 on everything, but I wanted to say, Don't pretty much destroy the box like I did trying to open it. There is no tape to cut. Just pull from the bottom and that part comes down. Of course they could put a clue somewhere. ;=)
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek

customer_reviews.title: Slow going in 3/8 ceramic tile
customer_reviews.text: Application was drilling a total of 8 mounting holes in 3/8 thick porcelain tile wall to hang towel warmer bars. It took two bits to finish the job as the first one snapped the tip halfway through the job. Drilling was slow, took much effort and maybe 5 minutes average per hole. Although these bits did work, if I had to do it over - I would order the more expensive diamond bits for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walker

customer_reviews.title: chewed through brick like a champion
customer_reviews.text: got these to see if they were better than my bosch bits (which were almost comically ineffective at drilling holes into brick) - good lord these things work well! my only complaint is that the 6mm bits are a little big, i wish it would have come with one smaller size - but that's not the manufacturer's fault, I got what I ordered. I'm definitely pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: Barely made a hole in a 1/4" tile after 15 minutes. I did use water but didnt seems to help. Then I had used bought other bit with diamond coating, sold on amazon and it worked like a charm. Main disadvantage is that it cos this bit set does not have diamond coating, hence does not work great of a tile.
customer_reviews.author: FWM

customer_reviews.title: Created drainage holes for plant pots
customer_reviews.text: I used these to drill holes in traditional Mexican plant pots that did not have any drainage holes. Worked perfectly and my pots did not crack. I placed masking tape on the bottom of the pot to prevent the bit from slipping and I applied GENTLE pressure to avoid cracking my pot. I’m happy I can now convert any plant pot to an outdoor pot with drainage holes.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed in these drill bits. First off they weren’t sturdy at all; one broke off the first time I used it! I don’t know If I got a bad batch or what but I wasn’t drilling through anything too hard (a ceramic pot) so it shouldn’t have broken. I’m going to try the other sizes out before I decide whether to return or not.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Needed with the Package
customer_reviews.text: No Instructions. I do not like that I had to return to Amazon to locate specifications and instructions. As a novice, I had no idea which bit to use for a specific project or that water is needed. I can provide a better review once I use the product. It took a while to think to check back here .
customer_reviews.author: Marva C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use these to drill holes into my plant pots that don't already have drain holes and they work perfect for the job. I start off with the smallest bit and work my way up. Sometimes it takes longer for the bit to go through some pots so just be patient and don't try to force it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The drill bits were alright going through ceramic pots, and clay ok-ish...but would not cut through glass or coffee cups. I used water to keep it from cracking but it seemed to generate cracks in every piece I cut. It didn’t break the pots - which is why I’ll give it 2 stars - but it messes with the structural integrity for sure.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Work amazingly well!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with these drill bits. I had quite a few ceramic flower pots and glazed flower pots that needed drainage holes drilled in them and my father (for one) kept telling me you cannot drill holes in glazed flower pots or you will shatter them, and I knew better. With these drill bits I have drilled holes in 10 of mine and 6 for one of my cousins. Absolutely love these drill bits.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: worked
customer_reviews.text: My tile is old and on 2 inches of wall on old wood. These went trough the tile and wall with effort, but did it. I don't have a lot of strength and was happy to have them. They did not go through wood. I ordered different for that. The shower hand rails are up and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Silloway

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardeners needing to drill holes in ceramic pots
customer_reviews.text: They did what I needed them to do. I had a couple glazed ceramic pots which my normal drill bits didn't want to drill into. These worked great! They're not pricey so I was prepared to risk them breaking or going dull on the first use but they're still great! Attaching a photo of one of the pots.
customer_reviews.author: StarsSky

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: Used the drill bits to put drainage holes in some smaller flower pots. Submerged the pots in water, leaving just about an inch above where I wanted to drill the holes. Used my cordless drill and with a little pressure had holes in a few minutes. Would buy again as it worked 100%.
customer_reviews.author: BELTCREEK

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 holes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worn to nub after only 6 holes! Used it to drill into mortar between ACME bricks. Drilled 4 holes on day 1, and then another hole on day 2, it was fine. Then a week later, while drilling the 6th hole, this is what happened. Total waste!
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for adding drainage holes in planters
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these to add drainage holes in a large variety of planters. Some ceramic, some terra cotta, some glass. These have worked wonderfully on everything so far. Make sure to use water while drilling. Medium pressure and go slow. You’ll have zero problems or breaks!
customer_reviews.author: FarmerJ

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Makita drill
customer_reviews.text: Only two bits, the smallest and the largest fit in our drill (Makita), which was on me, not checking beforehand. We got it to drill holes in ceramic pots. We drilled probably 10 pots adding water to keep it cool and keep dust down, but the big bit broke after that. The small one was too small for o I r purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia B

customer_reviews.title: I can turn anything into a planter now.
customer_reviews.text: I finally grew up and bought this set to keep on hand to drill holes in the bottom of ceramic planters for drainage. I used these on all sorts of material beyond ceramic like concrete, plastic, tin, and foam. Instead of limiting myself to buying planters with holes, I can turn anything into a planter now.
customer_reviews.author: Misderstand

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: These did the job I needed to do - a single 3/8" hole through tile. Use a punch or nail to score the spot you want to drill to keep the bit from sliding. Start with a smaller bit then move to the size you need. Use water to cool things down; an occasional spritz from a water bottle worked fine. Steady, moderate pressure and medium drill speed. And, most important, patience. It took me 15-20 minutes to drill a 3/8" (10mm) hole through floor tile. I can't comment on durability but the bits I used appear to have life left in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the simple things
customer_reviews.text: The drill bits are sharp. Used it on wood, brick, and dry walk and it had no issues. However, the durability started to fail a little after a dozen holes. The drill is just regular metal coated black and it starts to lose it edge when going through wood.
customer_reviews.author: David Chen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Masonry Drill Bits
customer_reviews.text: I've had a set of concrete drill bits that I've had for years. My Florida home is made entirely of reinforced concrete and any time I have to hang something up outside, I used my old masonry drill bits which took forever to drill a hole. I figured they were past their prime so I purchased this new set. These bits work GREAT! They drill into the concrete like "butta"!
customer_reviews.author: Kalibr

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to the power tools world but these drill bits are a game changer! I’m a succulant/plant lady and often find items without drainage holes. I used a drill bit to drill a small whole in a plastic water bottle and used it, as instructed, while drilling. Viola! Two metal buckets are not usable planters. They also worked well on a terra-cotta pot not pictured. Can’t say to try it out on glass!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: No for me
customer_reviews.text: I got these to drill through tile to hang a shower curtain. It worked fine, but took forever! At the end of the day I should have gotten a diamond bit to save time and make a cleaner hole. I will end up using these for wood, plastic, or anything I don't care about that's harder than that.
customer_reviews.author: CarlTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Tip broke while drilling
customer_reviews.text: I needed to drill into brick to install a security camera, and the tip broke on the first hole. I bought these because the product states it will drill into brick. Unfortunately, I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Girl

customer_reviews.title: these are GREAT for cutting holes in pots!
customer_reviews.text: I needed these to use with my drill to make holes in plastic, vinyl and ceramic pots. They work perfectly! I've only used them for a few days, so not sure how 'durable' they are, but they look very well made...so I expect good things.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, these are cheap bits
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. these bits do not last when drilling out ceramic. I have drilled probably three or four pots and you can see the damage in the photo. I'm going to have to replace these bits eventually, and I won't be replacing them with this brand. But if you do not need durability and just need a few holes, these will get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Sinor

customer_reviews.title: Drilled through brick with ease and without a hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: I was specifically looking for some bits to use without a hammer drill. I was skeptical of these bits as every demo you see on YouTube has people using hammer drills. But these worked just fine using a regular drill. Drilled through brick with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morrison

customer_reviews.title: No walk drill
customer_reviews.text: Drilled glass mounting channels, did not walk and holes were very good. This tile was very hard. Drill bit did not last long even using a water spray. the like of the bits were not great. But they were very good for not walking might try a 2 drill approach in the future
customer_reviews.author: R. Pro

customer_reviews.title: Works well for flower pots, glazed ceramic, terra cotta
customer_reviews.text: They work well. Allowed me to drill holes in my flower pots, terra cotta and glazed ceramic. One was almost an inch thick. You have to just keep applying medium pressure and be patient. The bit did look kind of tore up afterwards, but I think that’s probably inevitable.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great bits!
customer_reviews.text: Great set of bits! I use these for drilling holes in containers for plants. So far I have drilled holes in ceramic (glazed and unglazed), terracotta, and glass without any cracking or other problems. (I use water as a lubricant to keep the bit cool.) I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Glynda Giles

customer_reviews.title: Tile in bathroom...
customer_reviews.text: I had to mount a shelf on tile and these did the trick. Read up on tile drilling before attempting, but it’s pretty easy. I used a handheld driver and had great success. You can do it. Diy your way into a better home!
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Needed to drill several holes in my tile floor, & these drill bits were a perfect choice. Excellent quality & price.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about these because I really wanted to start drilling holes into my plant pots and they work very well!! Super easy to install into my drill and they go right through my ceramic pots! Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rounded on first use
customer_reviews.text: Rounded tip of bit after first use in my concrete floor. Would of thought I misused it if not for there package including concrete. Probably would work alright on non brick, metal, and concrete surfaces but can't recommend if that's the work your doing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pottery, Fired or Unfired
customer_reviews.text: What a great set for the money. Just drilled through a pottery plate - fired on one side. Used my drill press, supported the underside, and the drill zipped through the glaze and pottery without any splintering.
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: Great for drilling holes in ceramic pots
customer_reviews.text: I have used these to drill in about 20 pots! So glad to have drainage holes in my ceramic and terra cotta pots now. I made sure where I was drilling had some water on it as well. Would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: llscutie57

customer_reviews.title: Works well on porcelain tiles
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some of the reviewers, I had no difficulty drilling several small holes in highly polished bathroom porcelain tiles. I just took it slow and flushed the holes periodically with water as I was drilling into the tile.
customer_reviews.author: LWD

customer_reviews.title: Not for concrete, maybe works on softer material?
customer_reviews.text: I got halfway through the depth of my first hole in concrete, and the tip stripped on the 12mm bit. Must've got a bad heat treat. Looks like it works out for other material on the other reviews so I won't 1 star the product. I had to buy a standard (instead of metric) set from dewalt (but had to buy new concrete anchors) and it cuts through concrete like butter. My advice? Pay a little more and have a bit you can use more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Butler

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly to drill ceramic pots
customer_reviews.text: I used the smallest bit to drill a pilot hole in the bottom of a few ceramic pots before switching to the largest bit to bring the hole to its finished size. These holes will allow excess water to drain out, thus not drowning the plants. I used cool water and took my time, using low speed and light pressure to allow the bit to do the work.
customer_reviews.author: Southwest919

customer_reviews.title: useless! Went to Bosch carbide bits which worked well
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use on brick. useless! Went to Bosch carbide bits which worked well.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are a problem for US users
customer_reviews.text: I incorrectly assumed this set would allow me to drill holes for common US concrete scew sizes...wrong! I have 1/4" concrete screws that require 3/16" drill bit. The closest in this set is 6 mm bit, but that is too large by about 1.24 mm. I must return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Marty H

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I just tried out my QWORK drill bit set on my ceramic pots. Worked like a charm! Drilled right through the ceramic material without any problems. Definitely worth the $10 investment so now I have options when buying pots for my plants in the future. I no longer need to simply buy pots with pre-drilled drainage holes. I used the 6mm, 8 mm and 12 mm sizes in my DeWalt drill. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stosh

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say that will matter most to consumers is that this drill bit set works like magic. It fits the power drill (standard) I have at home and all the bits are sturdy (yes I’ve used all of them). They are in a thick plastic case - you can store them here perfectly and into the tool box so they aren’t difficult to find. Overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: FlowerV

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penney
customer_reviews.text: I used these bits to drill through a rather large 1/4" plate mirror. Before I started I was concerned about glass breakage. The bits worked great. I used water sprayed from a bottle to keep the bit cool. I needn't have worried it worked great. Great product at a nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Metric
customer_reviews.text: The purchaser should be aware that the drill bits are a metric size. A 12mm bit does not drill a hole that a 1/2 inch bolt can slide through, even though the ad shows U.S. standard sizes listed in parentheses. I learned this the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: More durable them exspected.
customer_reviews.text: These turned out better then expected. In the past, when purchasing tile drill bits, they were good for one use only. I'll say these are better than my purchased in the past.
customer_reviews.author: majestic

customer_reviews.title: Drill bits didn't hold up to wall tile
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to mount a stainless steel grab bar in the bathroom and had to drill through wall tile. The tips of the two smaller bits broke while drilling. They do not appear to be solid enough to do the jobs needed. Will return hopefully for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Rob

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Way better than a few others I’ve tried. Love that I have a variety of sizes to from time drill holes in pots - ceramic & terra cotta. Goes through easy peasy like butter with of course running water
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tile Drill Bits
customer_reviews.text: These drill bits are tough on tiles/concrete and designed to last. I drilled multiple holes through different kind of tiles successfully and had no problem with these drill bits. Theses drill bits are different with the ones bought at the Home Depot or Lowe’s for tiles and masonry. They proved to perform the work really well.
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective solution for your occasional chores
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy but gets the job done. Nice little accessory to have for hanging stuff on walls etc. Fits all standard size drills, and work like any drill bit should. The black coating is pointless since it strips away right as you start using the bits. For the price is good enough for occasional use, but if your a handy man that uses often, you maybe better off with higher quality bits.
customer_reviews.author: Leon_Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Wears down quick
customer_reviews.text: I drilled 4 holes into concrete block. Afterwards the bit I used was very worn and borderline dull. It got the job done, but not happy with the longevity and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality.
customer_reviews.text: Had to drill holes to install surveillance cameras. With some drill bits that I already had took me forever to drill 5 holes. I didn't have enough energy to drill a 6th one that I needed. I ordered this bits to install two more cameras and the holes were drilled in no time. I think each set of three holes took me less that six minutes. I did what the instructions said: keep the bits lubricated with water. And you don't need a hammer drill. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Westpointe

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill a hole in the top of a glass butter dish so I could put a knob on it. I read the directions and followed them -- a little unusual for me, but it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drill holes in tile and into studs to hang a shower grab bar. I put a piece of painters tape on the tile where I wanted to drilll to prevent the bit from walking. It went through the tile with little effort. I give these tile and glass bits a 5 star, highly recommend, great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Grace jaspersohn

customer_reviews.title: Go with diamond bits
customer_reviews.text: I needed to drill tile and thought that this would work. However, it takes forever! I switched to a diamond bit and cut my time by 1/3. They’re more expansive but they’ll save your arm from holding the drill for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Hays

customer_reviews.title: Keep a spray bottle of cool water handy!
customer_reviews.text: Tried drilling newly installed rectified porcelain tile to mount towel bars using standard carbide tipped masonry bits and got nowhere :-/ Ordered these amazing bits and put them to use immediately....WOW....what a difference!!! Warning: you MUST keep cooling the bit with water when drilling! I’m a very satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: Don Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Great on porcelain tile
customer_reviews.text: Works great drilling into porcelain tiles. Used it to installed safety grab bars in my shower. Suggest you place masking tape over the surface before drilling
customer_reviews.author: B.L.

customer_reviews.title: Rating based on using for concrete
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 10mm bit to drill a hole in concrete. These are advertised as able to be used on concrete. The tip of the bit didn't last 10 seconds when I tried to use it. It may work as advertised on tile, brick, glass, plastic and wood. If that was my anticipated use, maybe I'd be rating this differently. It absolutely does not work on concrete. They should stop advertising it as such. For use on concrete, this product is completely unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well on ceramic
customer_reviews.text: Work well on ceramics. Doesn't work so well on glass. Bits are not sharp. Each bit tip was coated in a layer of black paint (dipped?) that I removed prior use. Bit's needed sharpening after one use on glass.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Schroer

customer_reviews.title: Works on porcelain tiles.
customer_reviews.text: Gave these a shot and they performed perfectly as described. I used these on porcelain tile using smaller drill bit. I just went very slow with minimal pressure and used a hand spray bottle to keep the bit cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: the concrete won
customer_reviews.text: Concrete chewed the largest bit in the package to pieces. It did make a decent dent in the concrete, but the concrete definitely won that round, and there was not much left of the bit. First time using it, right out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Gardener101

customer_reviews.title: good for glass and ceramic
customer_reviews.text: I used these for drilling hole in ceramic and gladd containers so I can put plants in them. Only broke one thing so far, but that was because I was rushing and pushing on it too hard. Slow and steady is key.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for what I needed it for!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to drill holes in a few ceramic flower pots. Worked great on most of the pots... didn’t work well on glass, but to be fair, the item was not described as working on glass!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality- Drill bits will not hold an edge!
customer_reviews.text: Drill bit broke first time I used it even though I used lubricant and moderate pressure. Noticed that the drill bit lands would not hold an edge and their sharpness quickly dulled.
customer_reviews.author: Now I'm a Wiser Consumer!

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on ceramic planters.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product to drill drain holes in ceramic pots. Worked great and easy to use. Seem to be durable enough but only used a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli H

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. Needed to drill a hole in a glass vase to make a lamp. Started with the smallest and worked my way up to the largest. Slowly but surely I had a wonderful hole with no cracks. So happy to find the exact tool I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Jensen

customer_reviews.title: I did this a couple of weeks and my bit went dull. I ordered more light and this set of ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to drill into cinder blocks for solar lights I was putting up. I did this a couple of weeks and my bit went dull. I ordered more light and this set of drill bits. About 45 seconds a hole, perfect purchase and great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal for the Price
customer_reviews.text: These bits work very well for brick, and are quite inexpensive compared to hardware store prices. I haven't had them long enough to test durability.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very good drill for the money...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a Ring and had to drill a hole in cement. Well the drill adapter that came with the kit went missing and I had to purchase another one. This set was better than the drill that I received. Did the job well and without breaking the cement nor the drill. Will come back to seller to purchase another adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: A good buy!
customer_reviews.text: A good buy... when making a hole in glass, use the smallest drill and then use a bigger drill to enlarge hole. Use water as a cooling medium.
customer_reviews.author: ewanclyde

customer_reviews.title: They don't work correctly
customer_reviews.text: The only way I would recommend these bits, is if you want cracks in the glass that you are drilling into. As for the other surfaces that this product can be used for I cannot speak on it's behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carino

customer_reviews.title: Good, and at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for drilling holes in pots. Worked great on metal, glass, and ceramic. Perfect holes and no cracks, and I'm by no means a professional at drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Logan

customer_reviews.title: Not made for heavy duty jobs
customer_reviews.text: First time I used the 12mm bit on a concrete block, the spear-like tip just disintegrated immediately. May be okay for light jobs, but not for hard masonry surfaces like Concrete block, etc.
customer_reviews.author: famin

customer_reviews.title: Wear out quickly
customer_reviews.text: The Good: they get the job done. Perfect holes, tiles didn't crack. The Bad: I got 5 holes in porcelain with 1 bit before it bent. Was wetting the bit with water after each few seconds. Then I got 3 more with the 2nd 6mm bit, and I could see that it was getting dull, but that's all I needed. Take this into account when buying for a job.
customer_reviews.author: surrounded

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, made tuff
customer_reviews.text: Needed to drill into glass and clay vases and they worked wonderfully. Not sure yet of long term, however if anything changes, I'll update my rating.
customer_reviews.author: victoriaswan901

customer_reviews.title: THEY WORKED GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Every man should have this in their toolbox. I bought my set to drill cement blocks which make up my home. THEY WORKED GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Tile
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well I was shocked. Used them to mount a shower rod, drilled through what I thought was the hardest tile in the world. These bits made it feel like i was drilling through dry wall.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

product_meta.title: QWORK 5 Pcs Set (6, 6, 8, 10, 12mm) Multi-Material Drill Bit Set for Tile,Concrete, Brick, Glass, Plastic and Wood Tungsten Carbide Tip Best for Wall Mirror and Ceramic Tile on Concrete and Brick Wall
feature_bullets: 1) One drill bit replaces two drill bits (1x glass & tile drill bit + 1x Mansonry drill bit), ideal for drilling fastner holes in bathroom tiles, or wall mirrors. Once it drills through the tile or mirror this drill bit will cope easily with any masonry behind it
2) Spear pointed design strong tungsten carbide tip can easily penetrate various material(tile, concrete, brick, glass, plastic and wood,etc) and reduces breakout
3) 5 Pcs drill bit set with 4 different sizes: 2x 6mm(1/4"), 1x 8mm(5/16"), 1x 10mm(3/8"), 1x 12mm(1/2")

4) U type slot design with fast drilling dust remove, 3-flats shank allows drill bit to be held tightly and stably in power drill. When drilling hard material (glass, porcelain floor tile, marble or granite), please use water for lubrication

5) Heavy duty drill bits made by factory that manufactures products for big international tool brands with guaranteed quality. For genuine multi-material drill bit, please identify QWORK brand drill bits packed in sealed transparent plastic box with two sides of blue color stickers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,582 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
